name: Aida Syrkett
body:
###EDUCATION **Information Technology (ITEC), Bachelor of Science - Software Development Concentration** *Georgia Gwinnett College (GGC) - Lawrenceville, GA*
Overall GPA: 4.00
ITEC GPA: 4.00
Expected Graduation Date: May 2015 * 2012-14 President’s List, Georgia Gwinnett College (Fall 2012, Spring 2013, Fall 2013, Spring 2014) *Brookwood High School - Snellville, GA*
Overall GPA: 4.00
Class Rank: 11 out of 723 students
Graduation Date: May 2011 ###WORK EXPERIENCE **SAGE NORTH AMERICA (Small Business Solutions, Sage 50 – US Edition), Software Engineer Intern**
*May 2014 - Aug. 2014, Lawrenceville, GA* * Research and correct defects in product code, consisting of C# and C/C++ languages, in Sage 50 software * Created an XML utility executable in C# to unblock QA’s automation testing and continue SilkTests * Worked with agile team in daily stand-up meetings and completed assigned stories with VersionOne agile tool **GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE, Women in Information Technology Summer Boot Camp Advisor**
*May 12 – May 16, 2014, Lawrenceville, GA* * Teach and assist fellow female students with little to no programming experience through a crash course of Java * Presented information on Practice-It!, an online application for Java programming practice, and explained techniques and WIT support networks to succeed in future information technology classes **GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE (Academic Enhancement Center), Information Technology Peer Tutor**
*Jan. 2014 - May 2014, Lawrenceville, GA* * Tutor students in Introduction, Intermediate, and Advanced Programming (Java) courses and other IT courses, such as Introduction to Computing and Digital Media ###SKILLS ####Languages Java, C#, HTML/CSS, PHP, MySQL, Ruby on Rails ####Training/experience Agile project management, VersionOne training, Git ###HONORS / AWARDS * 2014 Practice-It! #1 Top User asyrkett with 1843 problems solved; http://practiceit.cs.washington.edu/ * 2011 National Runner-Up & Georgia Affiliate Winner of the NCWIT Awards for Aspirations in Computing * 2011 Accepted to Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) as Undergraduate * 2011 National Achievement Award & National Merit Commended Student ###EXTRACURRICULAR / VOLUNTEER SERVICE * Summer 2013 Women in Information Technology (WIT) at GGC, Advisory Board Member * 2013 Co-wrote grant application for National Center for Women & Information Technology (NCWIT) Student Seed Fund; Women in Information Technology (WIT) at GGC awarded $1000 * 2010 - 2011 Future Business Leaders of America, Secretary of Computer Science Club
